result.execSummary:
The defendant Melina Araceli Avila-Chavez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Election Fraud - Voting By Disqualification, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 12.13(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statues section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.
Defendant to provide a DNA Sample by August 25, 2022.

Court imposed a fine of $300.00.
Court ordered Defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA by December 27, 2022. Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment.
Restitution set to ZERO.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melina Araceli Avila-Chavez

records.addlTxt: Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:   EMILY BELL  $350.00

Defendant Melina Araceli Avila-Chavez appeared in Court with Attorney Emily Jane Bell. Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Sentencing hearing.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1:

Court imposed a fine of $300.00 and Defendant to provide a DNA Sample by August 25, 2022. Court ordered Defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, by December 27, 2022. Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment. Restitution set to ZERO.


Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Character Reference Letter submitted on behalf of Defendant; received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Melina Araceli Avila-Chavez in court with attorney Emily Jane Bell.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

Sentencing hearing adjourned, Branch 2.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Melina Araceli Avila-Chavez in court with attorney Emily Jane Bell.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Melina Araceli Avila-Chavez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case in court for status conference. Defense requests projected guilty plea date. Case remains calendared in Branch 2.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Melina Araceli Avila-Chavez in court with attorney Emily Jane Bell.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Melina Araceli Avila-Chavez in court with Attorney Emily Jane Bell.  Matthew Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON. 
Court took judicial notice of 18CF3146. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Detective D. Madden. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 2.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Melina Araceli Avila-Chavez in court.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel. Court appoints attorney Emily Bell, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The Court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning the 1st of the month after the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Case adjourned for preliminary hearing, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Melina Araceli Avila-Chavez
Current: 2524 N 57th ST, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States  (Effective: 01-28-2022)
Prior: 1542 South 65th Street, West Allis, WI 53214

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 1/31/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Melina Araceli Avila-Chavez in court with Attorney Katherine Graber.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs Branch  02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Indigency hearing scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 1/28/22 @ 1:30p
